item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Failure to do stated works as stated in your letter Ref 11495612 dated 10 Nov 25, 28th November
item.description:
Gloucester St, Winchcombe. Intended yellow line painting work has required no parking on road between 24-28 Nov 25. No work was actually done by you. Where would you like me to send my car park fees to for the period that you stopped me parking outside my house but didn't actually do the work you stated in the reference you were due to do? You have left restricted parking cones in place; why? You had your stated restricted parking period to do the work but you failed to execute it so I assume the cones are no longer valid.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 83, Gloucester Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unpermitted roadworks problem, 28th November
item.description:
TM not required as there are no works going on. Also these are for works off of the carriageway. Why couldn't these have been removed over the weekend.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kerb stone an surrounding tarmac surface damaged, 28th November
item.description:
Outside 55 Gretton Road. This has been cause by 2 weeks of traffic (606 Bus, farm vehicles, lorries) mounting the kerb due to the 3 way traffic light system that has been in place for the last to weeks for the new sewer works to service the new development opposite Privet Court Please note that the tarmac finish of the pavement along a long of kerb/drop kerb stones has also fatigued and shows minor cracking that over the winter months and frost expand and deteriorate and will need to have a new skim finish applied. Can this repair be scheduled at the earliest opportunity?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30,32, Gretton Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus stop, 28th November
item.description:
Serious design error on the placement of the bus stop at Pirton Corner (Churchdown) another part of the (Game Changer) cycle spine .As the bus approach’s Pirton stop from Hare and Hounds the driver has to have Second Sight it s impossible to see waiting Customers (alas no shelter ) and to indicate to the On coming driver you have to stand on the traffic light island ,this needs to be sorted .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pirton Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
